thread.title: College rewind: Hope women's soccer, VB wins; GVSU VB falls
thread.title_full: College rewind: Hope women's soccer, VB wins; GVSU VB falls

author: Staff reports
title: College rewind: Hope women's soccer, VB wins; GVSU VB falls
text: Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 11:07 PM Updated at 11:07 PM Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 11:07 PM Holland, Mich. Soccer Hope women edge Adrian The Flying Dutch won 1-0 on a goal from Elizabeth Perkins, off an assist from Allie Wittenbach. Mary Claire Theis (11-2-1) made one save in the shutout in net for Hope (11-2-1, 8-1-1). Hope men tie Alma The two teams fought to a 1-1 draw after two scoreless overtimes. Ryan Woodside scored an unassisted goal in the second half to tie the game for Hope (5-7-1, 2-5-1). Sam Barthel (3-4-1) stopped four shots in goal. Volleyball The Flying Dutch (14-4, 9-1 MIAA) won in sets of 25-17, 25-20 and 25-20. Sarah Feldpausch and Haley Muller each had eight kills, while Courtney Van Houzen added seven. Vanessa Reynhout chipped in five kills and freshman Katie Rietberg (West Ottawa) had four. Lauren Hazekamp contributed 30 assists, a game-high 17 digs and four kills. Ashland drops GVSU Ashland topped No. 21 Grand Valley State 3-1. The Lakers won set two and lost close sets in the first and third stanzas before falling, 23-25, 25-14, 20-25, 14-25. It is just the second conference loss of the 2015 for GVSU. Tennis GVSU women lock up GLIAC Tourney berth NORTH CANTON, Ohio â€“ The march to the 2015 GLIAC Women's Tennis Tournament rolls on as Grand Valley State cruised to a 7-2 victory over conference opponent Walsh on Saturday (Oct. 10). The quest for an undefeated season continues for Grand Valley State, as the win improves the team's record to 10-0 overall and 9-0 against GLIAC opposition. Hope, GVSU women compete at Warhawk Invite For Hope, Erin LaBarge won the No. 6 singles consolation final (6-1, 6-0) and teamed with Catherine Wingrove to win the No. 3 doubles final (8-6), while Taylor LaBarge won the No. 5 singles consolation final (6-2, 7-5, 1-0, 10-6). For GVSU, Courtney Lang won the No. 5 singles final (6-2, 6-4) and Katarina Samardzija took third in No. 3 singles draw (6-1, 6-2). Hockey Hope blanks LSSU The Flying Dutchmen won 13-0 in ACHA play. Peter Stewart had one goal and two assists, Brandon Flood recorded two goals and one assist. Garrett Gormley and Brandon Richardson each had two goals and Ryan Restum, Jakub Myska and Rodney Leversee each scored one. Caleb Wortz and Andrew Settecerri each tallied four assists. Cross Country Lakers sweep GLIAC Crossover The Laker men had nine runners inside the Top 10 and 12 runners total inside the Top 15 to score 19 points. The Laker women placed five runners inside the Top 10 and three inside the Top 5 to win the meet with 26 points. By Staff reports
